title: My ping has increased quite a bit in the last 3-4 days
body:
I sat down and started playing league with a couple of my friends right after work, and all of a sudden my ms increased by a good 30-40. I'm having lots of trouble with this increase {{item:3070}} . This increase only started a few days ago, and my internet is not to blame because I can play games like csgo and overwatch perfectly! My computer is also fine because I can play high intensity games and max them out without an issue (I'm getting a good 500 frames in league still even though I obviously don't need it.) To shorten or simplify this post, I'm wondering if the servers have changed at all, and if there's a way, whether or not the severs have changed, to fix my predicament. 
Thank you for any insight towards this problem!

replies.body:
Rineyy provided some good steps to start with. I'll also mention that inconsistencies in latency (ping) are generally caused by changes in ISP routing that create longer paths to the server. Because servers are in different geolocations, it's possible to have a great connection to one server but not another. If the basic troubleshooting guide Rineyy linked doesn't cause any noticeable change for you, I strongly recommend [reaching out to our tech specialists](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) as Rineyy had suggested. 

Let me know if you have any questions.

The servers were upgraded yesterday, which can be a possible cause in the increase but you stated this has been happening for the past few days so that probably isn't the case for you.

Firstly; [Troubleshoot your connectivity issues.](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues)

http://na.leagueoflegends.com/sites/default/files/styles/scale_xlarge/public/upload/su16_keyart_1920x1080_0.jpg?itok=6nj8mHjj

Drop a line with Riot’s [Technical Support Centre](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new?ticket_form_id=34190)
